messages.subject: Re: Mito Tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: It was during a conversation about Mito that this was sent along with the Haynes reference. I am checking now. It did not seem Mito to me but I m learning so
messages.messageBody:
It was during a conversation about Mito that this was sent along
with the Haynes reference. I am checking now. It did not seem Mito
to me but I'm learning so accepted it. I may have got it wrong, been
known to happen. Stand-by. John

I thought Umetada as well, I was waiting to get home to look through the
books.

Why Mito ?.

Rich

Richard Turner
Nihontô Message Board
<http://www.nihontomessageboard.com/nmb>

messages.subject: Re: Mito Tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Jim, Frankly, I bow to others opinions on this one. It does not look like any of my Mito. I ll see if I might get better pics. This one intrigues me. John
messages.messageBody:
Hi Jim, Frankly, I bow to others opinions on this one. It does not
look like any of my Mito. I'll see if I might get better pics. This
one intrigues me. John

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Mito Tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: I don t see the relationship to Mito.  It rather resembles Umetada (later) Tadatsugu group.  The flash is way too hot to say much about the patina.  It s
messages.messageBody:
I don't see the relationship to Mito. It rather resembles Umetada (later) Tadatsugu group. The flash is way too hot to say much about the patina. It's probably reddish brown under a reasonable exposure.

Jim



Here is something that may interest some. Recently I had an online
discussion about Mito Tsuba. This tsuba's image was sent to me as an
example of Mito. Apparently there is some discussion going on about
it's age. Mr Robert Haynes has put back the date by 100 years. That
isn't what I wonder about. It is the patina and colour. Has anyone
seen this type of patina before? John

http://ph.groups.yahoo.com/group/nihontostudy/photos/view/d020?b=4





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Mito Tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: Here is something that may interest some. Recently I had an online discussion about Mito Tsuba. This tsuba s image was sent to me as an example of Mito.
messages.messageBody:
Here is something that may interest some. Recently I had an online
discussion about Mito Tsuba. This tsuba's image was sent to me as an
example of Mito. Apparently there is some discussion going on about
it's age. Mr Robert Haynes has put back the date by 100 years. That
isn't what I wonder about. It is the patina and colour. Has anyone
seen this type of patina before? John

http://ph.groups.yahoo.com/group/nihontostudy/photos/view/d020?b=4
